Posts.Content: May 20, 2008 09:29PM footprintsangel wrote: I have a quiz for you, 1.To help prevent and control chronic swelling,you should remember hand and arm precautions: A. For six weeks after discharge. B. For six months after discharge. C. Until your doctor says you have developed new lymph pathways D. Until you feel fine. E. Forever.    2.To prevent infection in the infected arm: A. Cut you cuticles every week. B. Wear gloves when working with hot or sharp objects. C. Use an electric shaver. D. Stay out of bright sunlight. E. B and c only. 3. If swelling appears in the affected arm or hand soon after surgery: A. Elevate the arm 45 min. B. Call the Doctor immediately. C. Elevate your hand or arm above the level of the heart, Then open and close your hand 15 to 25 times D.A and c only. E. A b and c. 4. Call your doctor if: A. If the affected hand or arm or axilla (underarm) feels hot or swollen or is red. B. If you develop a fever over 100.5*F. C. If you want to shave under your arm with an electric shaver. D. A and b only E. A,b and c. 1. E, forever, You should remember these precautions for the rest of your life. Lymphedema can develop at any time. 2. E. Wear gloves with hot or sharp objects, Use electric shaver. Use sunblock to prevent sunburn. Do not cut cuticles. (Use lotion and cuticle stick 3. D. Elevate your arm 45 min and open and close your hand 15 to 25 times  2 or 3 times a day. 4.D Call your dr if you think you have a infection(hot ,red or swollen)
